body.p: POSTAL REGULATIONS REGARDING CIRCULAR MAILING Some persons having permits to mail matter in bulk under section 562, P. L. and R., present advertising matter in the form of large, unfolded printed sheets addressed for distribu- tion to box holders on rural and star routes. Since it is necessary to fold such large sheets before they can be distributed or placed in the boxes, the handling thereof may delay delivery of all other mail on the route. In view of the considerable saving in postage obtained by mailing adver- tising matter in bulk under section 562, and the convenience to the mail- ers of the simplified box-holder form of address, it is expected that mail- ers will fold matter to a reasonable size. Postmasters will please take this up with mailers who present matter of this kind and request that future mailings be folded to a size conveni- ent for handling, preferably not larg- er than 9 to 12 inches.
